dialogue.text: Oh, Sensei.
I’ve been thinking a lot about your new approach to teaching, and I have a question.
Sure. What’s up?
So, I understand the informal approach...but I don’t really understand why you want us to treat you more like a friend than an authoritative figure.
Isn’t respect important to you?
Of course. But you can still respect someone you see as your friend, can’t you?
You can. It just...seems like a very sudden change of heart to me.
Did something maybe...happen? Is it okay for me to ask that?
I don't want to...overstep my role as a student, but-
You're already venturing outside the box again by calling yourself that.
If this relationship is going to work, you're going to need to stay {i}inside{/i} the box and see yourself as a little more than just a student.
Y...You're right. And I'm sorry.
This is all just a little embarrassing for me. Being friends, I mean.
And why is that?
Well, you’re like...so much cooler than all of us. Wouldn’t being our friend make you look bad?
Look bad in front of who? I don’t talk to anyone else besides all of you girls.
So you...don't have a...g...girlfriend or...anything?
Nope. Just all of you.
I see...I think I get it now.
You’re a really...interesting person, Sensei...And I’m really glad that you’re our teacher.
All of the teachers I had before you...never really seemed to care.
But you actually listen to my problems when I come to you for help. And that...
That means a lot to me.
I'm just doing my job in the least exhausting way possible. And if you ever need help, you know where to find me.
Of course...
On that note, though...maybe I'll start visiting your office again sometime soon?
I stopped coming because I didn't really want to bother you, but...just...being around you helps sometimes.
Futaba's tone changes- like she's admitting something she's been keeping bottled up.
The only thing is that the weight of her admission is so light that I can't imagine there was any reason to keep it bottled up in the first place.
I'm sure mine would feel that same way to someone else, though.
If I could even pinpoint where that weight is coming from, that is.
Right now, it all just feels like recycled air.
Anyway...I should probably get going now.
I’ve got a few other things I need to do today.
I don't.
Oh, right! I’m...sorry for taking up so much of your time. I realize how valuable it is for someone like you.
I came here on my own, remember? You didn't take up anything.
Well, I'm sorry anyway. But I'm glad you stopped by again.
I’ll see you in[school], Sensei. And thank you for helping me with my homework.
Any time. I'll see you around, Futaba.
I leave the library and begin to wander the school grounds, hoping that my mind manages to choose a direction to steer me in.
It does, but not until I have already lapped the building three times.
Futaba and I made eye contact the second time I passed the library window.
She still smiled at me, even though she shouldn't have.
{i}Futaba’s affection has increased to [futaba_love]!{/i}
